title: Trump Is Pushing the U.S.-Europe Alliance to the Brink Over Greenland
summary: As President Trump tries to coerce European leaders over Greenland, they are pondering the unthinkable: Is an 80-year-old alliance doomed?

title: Federal Reserve Inquiry Clouds Trump’s Supreme Court Bid to Oust Lisa Cook
summary: The court is set to hear Ms. Cook’s case challenging her firing as the Justice Department investigates Jerome H. Powell, the central bank chair.

title: Powell Will Attend Supreme Court Hearing on Lisa Cook’s Lawsuit Against Trump
summary: A lawsuit by the Fed governor Lisa D. Cook has challenged President Trump’s push to fire her.

title: Trump’s Trade Negotiator Says Response to Court Loss Would Be Immediate
summary: If the Supreme Court rules against its tariffs, the Trump administration would begin replacing them immediately, said Jamieson Greer, the United States Trade Representative.

title: How 40 People Died In a Train Crash in Andalucia, Spain
summary: The victims of Spain’s deadliest rail crash in more than a decade included a police officer, journalists and a family returning from a musical.

title: What We Know About the Deadly High-Speed Train Crash in Spain
summary: The train crash in the southern region of Andalucía on Sunday was the deadliest in Spain since at least 2013.

title: Valentino Garavani, Regal Designer and Fashion’s ‘Last Emperor,’ Dies at 93
summary: Valentino, as he was called, created one of the most durable and fashionable labels and became an equal of his high society customers.

title: Valentino Garavani: A Life in Photos
summary: Valentino Garavani, fashion’s “Last Emperor,” believed in the power of beauty.

title: The Europeans Have Some Notes About American Sauna Culture
summary: Don’t get them started on the bathing suits. Or the dancing.

title: Protest at Minnesota Church Service Adds to Tensions Over ICE Tactics
summary: The Justice Department said it would investigate the protest over a pastor’s apparent role in immigration enforcement in the state.

title: U.S. Tells Judge It Will Appeal ICE Restrictions in Minneapolis
summary: Justice Department lawyers said they would ask an appellate court to review an injunction that imposes limits on the tactics used by immigration agents.

title: Splits Emerge Among Venezuelans as Revolutionary Dream Fades
summary: Supporters of former president Hugo Chávez, the anti-American socialist, are struggling to come to terms with their government’s pact with Washington.

title: Human Rights Lawyer Philippe Sands Fears a New Age of Impunity
summary: Philippe Sands, one of the world’s pre-eminent human rights attorneys, grew up in the shadow of bleak times. He worries that history is taking an unfortunate detour.

title: Clashes Erupt Around Syrian Prisons Holding Islamic State Fighters
summary: New tensions flared a day after a Kurdish-led militia agreed to hand over control of prisons holding some 8,000 Islamic State fighters to the Syrian government.

title: Cows Use Tools, Too, New Study Finds
summary: A pet cow named Veronika can scratch her own back with a broom — the first scientifically documented case of tool use in cows, researchers say.

title: Texas Schools Wait as Law on Ten Commandments Reaches Appeals Court
summary: A state law mandating the display of the Ten Commandments in every classroom has already divided Texas schools. Now a federal appeals court will decide its constitutionality.

title: Northern Lights Could Be Visible Across Much of the U.S. Tonight
summary: A severe solar storm could produce a visible show from Alabama to Northern California.

title: Wintry Weather Leads to 100-Vehicle Pileup on Interstate in Michigan
summary: Cars and trucks slid into one another and off a highway after a lake-effect snowstorm. Numerous injuries were reported, but no deaths.

title: The Popularity of ‘Heated Rivalry’ Masks a Darker Trend of Anti-Gay Bias
summary: We seem to be in a new era of anti-gay prejudice.

title: Trump Is Obsessed With Oil, but Chinese Batteries Will Soon Run the World
summary: China isn’t just building gigantic amounts of power. Its businesses are reshaping technological foundations to electrify the world.

title: Indiana Judge and His Wife Are Shot at Their Suburban Home
summary: The police in Lafayette, Ind., said they were investigating the nonfatal shootings of a Tippecanoe County Superior Court judge and his wife on Sunday.

title: Gaza’s Board of Peace: What to Know
summary: Numerous countries say they have been invited to join President Trump’s newly minted organization, which critics say could undermine the United Nations.

title: A Smaller Version of the Sphere in Las Vegas Is Planned for Maryland
summary: Gov. Wes Moore and the company behind the Sphere said the project in National Harbor, in the Washington metro area, would create jobs and become a landmark attraction.
